intro: Corispermum patelliforme var. pelviforme, commonly known as the pelviform bladderwrack, is a marine plant belonging to the family Fucaceae. It is a type of brown algae that typically grows in intertidal zones along rocky coastlines. The plant has a distinctive, inflated, bladder-like structure that helps it float and retain moisture. Its morphology includes a central stalk with branching fronds, and it is often found in the northern Atlantic Ocean. This variety is characterized by its unique shape and ecological adaptations to coastal environments.
